data.title: XII. Correspondence from Sylvia Beach & Shakespeare and Company - James Joyce Collection
data.text:
XII. Correspondence from Sylvia Beach & Shakespeare and Company

Beach to Charles Abbott

Beach, c/o Mrs. Frederick Dennis, Martindale, Greenwich, Connecticut, [U.S.A.] to Charles Abbott, Lockwood Memorial Library, University of Buffalo, Buffalo 14, New York, [U.S.A.]; 17 June 1959. A.l.s.: 1l recto–verso.

Beach to Elbridge Adams

Beach to [Elbridge AdaMS ], New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; n.d. [summer 1930]. T. copy of telegram, with computations on the recto in pencil in Beach’s hand.

Albatross PressAlbatross Press

See Beach to M.C. Wegner.

American Printing House for the Blind

American Printing House for the Blind. See Beach to A.C. Ellis.

Beach to Augener Ltd.

[Beach] to Augener Ltd., 18 Great Marlborough Street, London, W.1, [England]; 21 April 1931. T.l.c.

Notes: Also see XIII: Augener Ltd. to Beach

[Beach] to Augener Ltd., 18 Great Marlborough Street, London, W.1., [England]; 25 April 1931. T.l.c.

Beach to Bibljoteka Groszowa

Beach to Bibljoteka Groszowa, Moniuszki 11, Warsaw, [Poland]; 21 January 1930, French. T.c.

Beach to Zygmunt Bornstein

[Beach] to Bornstein, Pokredbank, Krakow, Poland ; [?21/22 January 1930]. Telegram copy.Notes: Also see XIII: Zygymut Bornstein to Shakespeare and Company.

[Beach] to Bornstein, Pokredbank, Krakow, Poland; [27 January 1930]. Telegram copy, with a notation in Beach’s hand in pencil.

Beach to Bornstein, Rynek Debnicki 6, Krakow, Poland; 28 January 1930. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Bornstein, Rynek Debnicki 6, Krakow, Poland; 28 January 1930, with envelope. T.l.4.a. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Bornstein, Rynek Debnicki 6, Krakow, Poland; 6 February 1930. T.l.c.

Beach to Bornstein, Rynek Debnicki 6, Krakow, Poland; 30 November 1932. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Dr. [Louis] Borsch, [Paris, France]; n.d., [Fall 1923]. A.l., with a draft note in Beach’s hand.

Beach to [Ernest A.] Boyd, [New York, New York, U.S.A.] ; n.d. [October 1922]. T.l.c.s.: 4l.

Notes: Also see XI: Ernest A. Boyd to Joyce and XIII: Ernest A. Boyd to Beach.

Beach to John Boyle Beach

La Féclaz, Les Déserts, Savoie, France to John Boyle, Timelife, Paris; 29 July 1950. Draft of telegram and with note, all in Beach’s hand.

Notes: Also see XIII: John Boyle to Beach

Beach to Daniel Brody

[Beach] to Brody, Rhein-Verlag, 7 Holzgartenstrasse, Stuttgart, Germany; 18 September 1929. T.l.c.

Notes: Also see XI: Daniel Brody to Joyce and XIII: Daniel Brody to Beach as well as the correspondence between Brody, Joyce, Beach and Léon in the National Library of Ireland (see JJPL 211–213).

Beach to Brody, Rhein-Verlag, 7 Holzgartenstrasse, Stuttgart, Germany; 19 October 1929. T.l.c.: 2l, with another leaf with notations, probably in Beach’s hand, in pencil.

[Beach] to Brody, Rhein-Verlag, Koniginstrasse 35a, Munich, Germany; 11 February 1930. T.l.c., with a note in Beach’s hand: 2l.

[Beach] to Brody; 15 March 1930. T.l.c., with notations in Beach’s hand in pencil: 2l.

[Beach] to Brody, Rhein-Verlag, Koniginstrasse 35a, Munich, [Germany]; 11 December 1930. T.l.c.: 2l.

[Beach] to Brody, Rhein-Verlag, Koniginstrasse 35a, Munich, Germany; 4 July 1932. T.l.c.

Beach to [Brody], Rhein-Verlag, Konigstrasse 35a, Munich, [Germany]; 30 November 1932. T.l.c.

Beach to Alexander H. Buchman, 1869 Alvason Road, East Cleveland, Ohio, [U.S.A.]; 2 May 1931. T.l.c.

Notes: Also see XIII: Alexander H. Buchman to Beach.

University of BuffaloUniversity of Buffalo

See Beach to Abbott, Beach to Clifford and Sparkle Furnas, and Beach to Oscar Silverman.

Beach to Padraic Colum

Beach to Padraic Colum, New Canaan, Connecticut, U.S.A.; [27 August 1931]. Typed copy of telegram.

Notes: Also see XIII: Padraic Colum to Beach.

Beach to Clarence Connor

Beach to Clarence Connor, Annville, Pennsylvania, U.S.A.; 5 December 1949. T.l.c.s., with another sheet with typed notations by Beach.

[Beach] to Crosby Continental Editions/Black Sun Press, 2, rue Cardinale, Paris, [France]; 2 March 1932, French. T.l.c.Notes: Also see XI: Harry and Caresse Crosby to Joyce and XIII: Harry and Caresse Crosby to Beach as well as related correspondence in the National Library of Ireland (see JJPL 164–166).

[Beach] to Editions Crosby, 111, rue [Réamur], Paris, [France]; 27 May 1933, French. T.l.c.

Imprimerie Darantiere Imprimerie Darantiere

See Beach to Bernard d’Avout. Also see X: Joyce and Beach to Maurice Hirschwald and XIV: Maurice Darantiere to Shakespeare and Company: Sylvia Beach and James Joyce.

Beach to Baron Bernard d’Avout

[Beach] to d’Avout, Imprimerie Darantiere, 13, rue Paul Cabet, Dijon, [France]; 24 October 1931, French. T.l.c.: 2l.

[Beach] to Baron Bernard d‘Avout, Imprimerie Darantiere, 13, rue Paul Cabet, Dijon, [France]; 15 February 1934, French. T.l.c.Notes: Also see XIV: Maurice Darantiere to Beach and Joyce.

[Beach] to de la Torre Bueno, Macmillan Company, 60 Fifth Avenue, New York, [N. Y., U.S.A.]; 20 November 1931. T.l.c.Notes: Also see XI: J.R. de la Torre Bueno to Joyce and XIII: J.R. de la Torre Bueno to Beach.

[Beach] to de la Torre Bueno, Macmillan Company, 60 Fifth Avenue, New York, [N. Y., U.S.A.]; 29 December 1931. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Eugene Dyche, 1704 W. 20, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, U.S.A.; 7 March 1933. T.l.c.: 2l.

Beach to A.C. Ellis, Superintendent, American Printing House for the Blind, 1839 Frankfort, Kentucky, U.S.A.; 16 March 1933. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Faber & Faber, 24 Russell Square, London, W.C.1, [England]; 16 March 1933. T.l.c.

Notes: See also XI: T.S. Eliot to Joyce, and XIII: T.S. Eliot to Beach and XIII: Faber & Faber to Beach as well as related Faber & Faber correspondence in the National Library of Ireland (see JJPL 171–189).

[Beach] to Jean Fromek, Editions Odeon, Chotkova II, Prague III, [Czechoslovakia]; 25 March 1930, French. T.l.c.

Notes: Also see XIII: Jean Fromek to Beach.

Beach to Clifford and [Sparkle] Furnas, Chancellor’s Office, University of Buffalo, 3435 Main Street, Buffalo 14, New York, U.S.A.; 15 May 1959, with envelope. A.card.s.

Beach to Crosby Gaige

Beach to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; [2 June 1928]. Typed copy of telegram, with a note in Beach’s hand.Notes: Also see Beach to James R. Wells and XI: Crosby Gaige to Joyce and XIII: Crosby Gaige to Beach.

[Beach] to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; 6 June 1928. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York , U.S.A.]; 7 June 1928. T.l.c.

Beach to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; [10 July 1928]. Typed copy of telegram, with the date in Beach’s hand.

Beach to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; [25 September 1928]. Typed copy of telegram, with the date and a note in Beach’s hand.

Beach to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; [26 September 1928]. Typed copy of telegram, with the date and note in Beach’s hand in pencil.

[Beach] to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; 1 October 1928. T.l.c.

Beach to Gaige, 229 West 42nd Street, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; [25 October 1928]. Typed copy of telegram, with date and note in Beach’s hand in pencil.

Beach to Lewis Galantiere

Beach to [Lewis] Galantiere, 126 Waverly Place, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; 21 February 1927. Typed copy of telegram, with note in Beach’s hand.

Notes: Also see XIII: Lewis Galantiere to Beach.

Beach to Harper, Szlapka, & Harper

[Beach] to Harper, Szlapka, & Harper, 32 Avenue de l’Opéra, Paris, [France]; 16 October 1931. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Sir Paul Harvey, c/o Oxford University Press, Amen House, Warwick Square, London, E.C.4, [England]; 2 June 1933. T.l.c.

Beach to James Joyce

Beach to James Joyce

Beach to Alfred A. Knopf

Beach to Knopf, 730 Fifth Avenue, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; 4 March 1931. T.l.c.Notes: Also see XIII: Alfred A. Knopf to Beach.

Beach to [Knopf], Knopf, New York, New York, U.S.A.; [3 April 1931]. Typed copy of telegram, with a notation in Beach’s hand and a postal receipt.

Beach to Paul Léon

Beach to Léon, 27, rue Casimir Périer, Paris, [France]; 4 February 1932. T.l.c.: 2l.Notes: A copy of this letter is not in National Library of Ireland James Joyce/Paul Léon Collection. The earliest letter from Beach to Léon in the NLI Collection is dated 9 February 1932. (The NLI holds further correspondence from Beach to Léon of which there are no copies in the Buffalo Collection; see JJPL 159–164.) Also see XI: Paul Léon to Joyce and XIII: Léon to Beach.

1.a. T.l.c.: 2l.

[Beach] to Léon; 18 August 1932. T.l.c.Notes: A copy of this letter is not in NLI James Joyce/Paul Léon Collection.

[Beach] to Léon; 31 August 1932. Typed draft of letter with revisions and corrections.Notes: A copy of this letter is not in NLI James Joyce/Paul Léon Collection, although the enclosure accompanying it is there.

4.a. T.l.c.

Beach to Willy Marquardt

Beach to Willy Marquardt, Stuttgart, Germany; 30 September 1929, with an envelope with notations in an unknown hand on it in German. T.l.s.

Notes: This letter was returned to Beach. See also XIII: Willy Marquardt (as well as Rhine-Verlag-related correspondence to Joyce and from/to Beach).

Beach to Alida Monro

[Beach] to Alida [Monro], The Poetry Bookshop, [38] Great Russell Street, London, [England]; 24 February 1931. T.l.c.Notes: See also XI: Harold Monro to Joyce and XIII: Alida Monro and Harold Monro to Beach.

[Beach] to Alida [Monro], The Poetry Bookshop, 38 Great Russell Street, London, W.C.1, [England]; 8 March 1932. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Nagamatsu, Isugino, & Ito, c/o Hitoshi Ito, 18 Nishimachi, Nakano Machi, Tokyo, [Japan]; 4 September 1931. T.l.c.Notes: Also see XI: Sadamu Nagamatsu, Hisanori Tsujino and Hitoshi Ito to Joyce; XIII: Nagamatsu, Tsujino and Ito to Beach and related correspondence in the National Library of Ireland (see JJPL 224).

[Beach] to Nagamatsu, Tsujino, & Ito, c/o Dauchi Shobo, 5 Ishibancho Kojimachi, Tokyo, [Japan]; 31 March 1933. T.l.c.

Beach to the New York Evening Post

Beachto The New York Evening Post, [New York, New York, U.S.A.]; 16 November [1926]. Typed telegram copy, with 6 further carbon copies.

Notes: Also see Beach to Ernest Boyd; XI: Boyd to Joyce and XIII: Boyd to Beach and XIII: Daniel Henderson to Beach.

Beach to Y. (Yoshisaburo) Okakura, Naka-Arai, Outside Tokyo, [Japan]; 4 July 1932. T.l.c.: 2l.

Notes: Also see the related correspondence in the National Library of Ireland (see JJPL 224).

Beach to the Musical Editor, The Oxford University Press, Amen House, Warwick Square, London, E.C.4, [England]; 21 January 1931. Beach to The Oxford University Press, Amen House, Warwick Square, London, E.C.4, [England]; 8 February 1933. T.l.c.

[Beach] to The Oxford University Press, Amen House, Warwick Square, London, E.C.4, [England]; 12 January 1934. T.l.c.

[Beach] to Ewan Phillips, The Institute of Contemporary Arts, 6 Fitzroy Street, London, W.1. [England]; 16 May 1950. T.l.c. with a holograph draft of the enclosure.EnclosuresTwo typed itemized inventories, dated 16 May 1950.

William Rudge PublicationsWilliam Rudge Publications

Beach to Jacob Schwartz

Beach to Jacob Schwartz, Ulysses Bookshop, 20 Bury Street, London, W. C. 1. [England]; 31 January 1931. T.l.c., with a note in Beach’s hand in blue crayon.

Notes: Other letters to and from Sylvia Beach and Jacob Schwartz are in the Firestone Library, Princeton University (Box 120, f.2). See also XI: Schwartz to Joyce.

Servire PressServire Press

Beach to Silverman; 25 November 1958. T.l.s.: 1l recto–verso.Notes: Also see XIII: Silverman to Beach.

Beach to Kazuo Watanabe

Beach to “Josephine” [Harriet Shaw Weaver]

Beach to “Josephine ” [Weaver], 4 Rawlison Road, Oxford, [England]; 8 April 1957. T.l.c.: 1l recto–verso.

Notes: >The majority of the extant letters from Beach to Weaver are in the “Joyce Collection” (GB 0103 JOYCE) University College London Library. Some of the correspondence is also in the British Library, see ADD MSS 57345–57353. Also see XIII: Harriet Shaw Weaver to Beach.

Beach to “Josephine” [Weaver], Castle End, Saffron Walden, Essex, [England]; 9 April 1957. T.l.c.

Beach to “Josephine” [Weaver], Castle End, Saffron Walden, Essex, [England]; 9 April 1957. Duplicate T.l.c.

Beach to “Josephine” [Weaver]; 30 April 1957. T.l.s.

Beach to “Josephine” [Weaver]; 30 April 1957. Duplicate T.l.c.

Beach to “Josephine” [Weaver]; n.d. [probably April 1957]. T.l.Notes: Variant draft of letter, presumably none of these letters were posted, see below.

[Beach] to “Josephine” [Weaver]; n.d. [April 1957]. T.l.Notes: Draft of letter.

Beach to “Josephine” [Weaver]; [April 1957]. T.l.s., with a notation in Beach’s hand on the recto.Notes: Subsequent draft of previous letter.

[Beach] to “Josephine” [Weaver] ; n.d. [April 1957]. T.l.[c].Notes: This version differs slightly from preceding letter and appears to be carbon of the letter sent.

Beach to “Josephine” [Weaver]; [9 December 1957]. T.l.s.Notes: According to Beach’s notation on the letter, this letter was never posted and the signature is typed.

Beach to M.C. Wegner

[Beach] to M.C. Wegner, Director, Albatross [Press], 37, rue Boulard, Paris, [France]; 9 September 1932. T.l.c.

Notes: Also see XIII: Wegner to Beach as well as related Albatross Press correspondence in the National Library of Ireland (see JJPL 149–159).

Beach to James R. Wells

[Beachand Joyce] to Wells; [5 December 1927]. T. & A.l.: 1l recto–verso.

Notes: This is a draft of the letter; typed and revised in Joyce’s hand in pencil on the recto and verso and revised in Beach’s hand in ink on the recto. See XI: Wells to Joyce and XIII: Wells to Beach.

[Beachand Joyce] to Wells, William Rudge Publications, 475 Fifth Avenue, New York, [New York, U.S.A.]; 5 December 1927. T.l.c.: 3l.

Notes: Typed version of above letter.
